page.title: List of serial killers by number of victims

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/VarneyTrevor1296|VarneyTrevor1296]] ([[User talk:VarneyTrevor1296|talk]]) to last version by Lepricavark
revision.text:
{{short description|Wikipedia list article}} {{hatnote|This list does not include [[List of serial killers before 1900|serial killers active only before the year 1900]].}} {{Dynamic list}} {{pp|small=yes}} {{Sprotected|small = yes}} {{Multiple issues| {{original research|date=December 2016}} {{more citations needed|date=December 2012}} }} A [[serial killer]] is typically a person who [[murder]]s three or more people, in two or more separate events over a period of time, for primarily psychological reasons.''Macmillan Encyclopedia of Death and Dying'' entry on [http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_gx5214/is_2003/ai_n19132282 "Serial Killers"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071105174409/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_gx5214/is_2003/ai_n19132282 |date=2007-11-05 }} (2003) by Sandra Burkhalte ChmelirA serial killer is most commonly defined as a person who kills three or more people for psychological gratification; reliable sources over the years agree. See, for example: * {{cite web |title=Serial killer| publisher=[[TheFreeDictionary.com]]| accessdate=15 June 2016|url=http://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/serial+killer|quote=A person who murders 3+ people over a period of > 30 days, with an inactive period between each murder, and whose motivation for killing is largely based on psychological gratification.}} * {{cite book| first1 = Ronald M. |last1=Holmes |first2=Stephen T. |last2=Holmes|title = Contemporary Perspectives on Serial Murder | publisher = [[SAGE Publications]] | year = 1998 | page = 1 | accessdate = 15 June 2016 |isbn = 978-0-7619-1421-1| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=0yfoJz6jHwkC&pg=PA1|quote=Serial murder is the killing of three or more people over a period of more than 30 days, with a significant cooling-off period between the murders [...] The baseline number of three victims appears to be most common among those who are the academic authorities in the field. The time frame also appears to be an agreed-upon component of the definition.}} * {{cite book| author = Wayne Petherick|title =Serial Crime: Theoretical and Practical Issues in Behavioral Profiling| publisher = [[Academic Press]] | year = 2005 | page = 190| accessdate = 15 June 2016 |isbn = 978-0-08-046854-9| url =https://books.google.com/books?id=U3-zunZ5eF4C&pg=PA190|quote=Three killings seem to be required in the most popular operational definition of serial killing since they are enough to provide a pattern within the killings without being overly restrictive.}} * {{cite book| author = R. Barri Flowers|title = The Dynamics of Murder: Kill or Be Killed | publisher = [[CRC Press]] | year = 2012 | page = 195| accessdate = 15 June 2016 |isbn = 978-1-4398-7974-0| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=MQnSBQAAQBAJ&pg=PA195 |quote=In general, most experts on serial murder require that a minimum of three murders be committed at different times and usually different places for a person to qualify as a serial killer.}} * {{cite book| author = Harold Schechter|title = The A to Z Encyclopedia of Serial Killers | publisher = [[Simon and Schuster]] | year = 2012 | page = 73| accessdate = 15 June 2016|isbn = 978-1-4391-3885-4| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=zM7ROzJPK2MC&pg=PA73 |quote= Most experts seem to agree, however, that to qualify as a serial killer, an individual has to slay a minimum of three unrelated victims.}} There are gaps of time between the killings, which may range from a few days to months, or many years. This list shows serial killers from the 20th century to present day by number of [[Victim of a crime|victims]]. In many cases, the exact number of victims assigned to a serial killer is not known, and even if that person is convicted of a few, there can be the possibility that they killed many more. Organization and ranking of serial killings is made difficult by the complex nature of serial killers and incomplete knowledge of the full extent of many killers' crimes. To address this, multiple categories have been provided in order to more accurately describe the nature of certain serial murders. This is not a reflection of an individual's overall rank, which may or may not vary depending on personal opinion concerning the nature and circumstances of their crimes. The fourth column in the table states the number of victims definitely assigned to that particular serial killer, and thus the table is in order of that figure. The fifth column states the number of possible victims the killer could have murdered. Some of these crimes are unsolved, but were included because they are the work of a serial killer, despite nobody being caught. This list does not necessarily include [[war criminal]]s or members of [[democidal]] governments, such as [[Adolf Hitler]], [[Hideki Tojo]], [[Mao Zedong]], [[Joseph Stalin]], or [[Pol Pot]]. == Serial killers with the highest known victim count == The most prolific modern serial killer is [[Harold Shipman]], with 218 proven murders and possibly as many as 250 ([[#Medical professionals and pseudo-medical professionals|see "Medical professionals", below]]). Excluding these "Medical professionals and pseudo-medical professionals", with their ability to kill simply and in plain sight, and [[#Serial killer groups and couples|Serial killer groups and couples (below)]], this list is a compilation of modern serial killers currently with the highest verifiable murder count. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Name ! Country ! Years active ! data-sort-type="number"| Proven victims ! data-sort-type="number"| Possible victims ! Notes |- | [[Luis Garavito]] | {{COL}}
{{ECU}}{{cite news |last=|first=|date=29 November 1999|title=La Bestia|trans-title=The Beast|url=http://www.semana.com/nacion/articulo/la-bestia/51721-3|language=Spanish|work=Semana|location=Bogota, Colombia|access-date=9 September 2017}}
{{flag|Venezuela|1954}} | 1992 to 1999 | 138 | 172–300+ | Child-murderer, torture-killer, and rapist known as {{lang|es|"La Bestia"}} ("The Beast"). Confessed to killing 140 boys between eight and 16 years old over a seven-year period in Colombia and neighboring countries. He is suspected of murdering over 300 victims, mostly street children.{{cite book |last=Benecke |first=Mark |title=Murderous Methods: Using Forensic Science to Solve Lethal Crimes |year=2005 |publisher=Columbia University Press |isbn=978-0-231-13118-6 |url=https://archive.org/details/murderousmethods00bene }}{{cite book|author=Peter Vronsky|title=Serial Killers: The Method and Madness of Monsters|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=vB2G-9lgvCEC&pg=PA35|year=2004|publisher=Berkley Books|isbn=978-0-425-19640-3|page=35}} |- | data-sort-value="López, Pedro"|[[Pedro López (serial killer)|Pedro López]] | {{COL}}
{{PER}}
{{ECU}} | 1969 to 1979 | 110 | 300+ | Child-murderer and rapist, known as "The Monster of [[Andes|the Andes]]". Targeted young girls, between the ages of eight and 12. Arrested in 1980 and convicted in 1983 of killing three young girls, but claimed to have killed hundreds. Despite being believed to be one of the most prolific serial killers of the twentieth century, he was released in the late 1990s.{{cite web|title=All About Pedro Lopez|url=http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/notorious/pedro_lopez/4.html|website=crimelibrary.com|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140226101746/http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/notorious/pedro_lopez/4.html|archivedate=26 February 2014}} |- | data-sort-value="Javed, Iqbal"|[[Javed Iqbal (serial killer)|Javed Iqbal]] | {{Flag|Pakistan}} | 1998 to 1999 | 100 | 100 | Child-murderer and rapist, known as "Kukri", Iqbal murdered 100 street children by strangling them and covering up his crimes by dissolving the bodies with acid. He was arrested in 1999 thanks to a letter he sent a newspaper, and was set to be executed in the manner described by the judge who stated, "You will be strangled to death in front of the parents whose children you killed, Your body will then be cut into 100 pieces and put in acid, the same way you killed the children.""[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/678553.stm Death for Pakistan serial killer]." ''[[BBC]]''. Thursday 16 March 2000. However, he died in custody before he could be executed.{{cite web|url=http://www.dawn.com/news/717/lahore-javed-iqbal-accomplice-found-dead-in-jail |title=dawn.com |publisher=dawn.com |date= 10 October 2001|accessdate=2019-09-03}} |- | [[Mikhail Popkov]] | {{RUS}} | 1992 to 2010 | 78 | 81 | Serial rapist-killer nicknamed "The [[Werewolf]]", who was active for two decades in [[Angarsk]], [[Irkutsk]] and [[Vladivostok]]. After being convicted of 22 murders in 2015, he confessed to an additional 59 murders, of which he was convicted of 56 in 2018.{{cite web|url=https://washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2017/01/12/werewolf-of-siberia-ranked-among-worst-serial-killers-ever-after-confessing-to-81-victims-says-russian-media/|title='Werewolf' of Siberia ranked among worst serial killers ever after confessing to 81 victims, says Russian media|author=Barbash, Fred|work=[[Washington Post]]|date=12 January 2018|accessdate=18 January 2018|url-status=live|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180119060631/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2017/01/12/werewolf-of-siberia-ranked-among-worst-serial-killers-ever-after-confessing-to-81-victims-says-russian-media/|archivedate=19 January 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/dec/10/russias-worst-serial-killer-jailed-for-life-mikhail-popkov|title=Russian serial killer convicted of 56 more murders|date=10 December 2018|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=10 December 2018}} |- | [[Daniel Camargo Barbosa]] | {{COL}}
{{ECU}}
{{BRA}} (alleged)Cruz Niño, Esteban (2014) ''Los monstruos en Colombia sí existen.'' Penguin Random House. | 1974 to 1986 | 72 | 180 | Child and woman murderer, believed to have possibly raped and killed over 150 victims, primarily targeting female children as they were more likely to be virgins. Confessed to killing 72 victims. He strangled young girls in Colombia and was arrested, but he escaped from prison and he started killing in Ecuador; rearrested in 1986, he was incarcerated in the same Ecuadorian prison as 300+ serial killer [[Pedro López (serial killer)|Pedro López]].{{Citation needed|date=September 2019}} Camargo was killed in jail by the nephew of one of his victims.{{cite news|title=La Infancia y La Virginidad: Dos Vertientes Del Crimen |newspaper=Hoy |date=15 November 1994 |accessdate=31 March 2010 |location=Equador |language=Spanish |trans-title=Children and Virginity: Twofold Crime |url=http://www.explored.com.ec/noticias-ecuador/la-infancia-y-la-virginidad-dos-vertientes-del-crimen-26963-26963.html |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110125153025/http://www.explored.com.ec/noticias-ecuador/la-infancia-y-la-virginidad-dos-vertientes-del-crimen-26963-26963.html |archivedate=25 January 2011 |df= }} |- | [[Pedro Rodrigues Filho]] | {{BRA}} | 1967 to 2003 | 71 | 100+ | He claimed to have killed over 100 victims, 47 of them inmates. He also killed his father and ate a piece of his heart. He killed his first two victims at the age of 14; he was first arrested in 1973. Convicted and sentenced to 128 years, but the maximum one can serve in Brazil is 30 years.[https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=pt&u=http://www.reclamando.com.br/%3Faction%3Dread%26eid%3D295%26id%3D879%26system%3Dnews&oi=translate&resnum=2&ct=result&prev=/search%3Fq%3D%2522Pedrinho%2BMatador%2522%26start%3D50%26hl%3Den%26safe%3Doff%26rlz%3D1T4ADBF_enCA238CA238%26sa%3DN "What the science has discovered about the coldest of criminals – the psychopath"] (translated from Portuguese) |- |[[Kampatimar Shankariya]] |{{Flag|India}} | 1977 to 1978 | 70 | 70+ | This mysterious Indian serial killer used a hammer to kill over 70 men and women between 1978 and 1979, his last words were, "I have murdered in vain," he declared. "Nobody should become like me.". {{Cite book|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=DwNVbOcTncwC&pg=PA239&lpg=PA239&dq=kampatimar+shankariya&source=bl&ots=B3BDArYx9I&sig=ACfU3U3O0X2NMwLzbpZUDDdCe2SyDZmsPw&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjjypSZ_ozmAhXWbSsKHba0Ai04ChDoATAHegQIChAB#v=onepage&q=kampatimar%20shankariya&f=false|title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers|last=Newton|first=Michael|publisher=Infobase Publishing|year=2006|isbn=978-0-8160-6987-3|location=|pages=239|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=https://aajtak.intoday.in/crime/story/unknown-facts-about-indian-serial-killer-kampatimar-shankariya-from-rajasthan-1-887624.html|title=हथौड़े मार 70 लोगों की हत्या करने वाले 'कनपटीमार' की खौफनाक दास्तान|date=2016-09-14|website=aajtak.intoday.in|language=hi|access-date=2019-11-28}}{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=Wu1oDQAAQBAJ&pg=PT11&dq=kampatimar+shankariya&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi6xMKrgo3mAhUigUsFHZkXAFwQ6AEIMTAB#v=onepage&q=kampatimar%20shankariya&f=false|title=The Serial Killer Files|last=Simpson|first=Paul|date=2017-05-18|publisher=Little, Brown Book Group|isbn=978-1-4721-3673-2|language=en}}{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=mknzvz_5CiEC&pg=PA89&dq=kampatimar+shankariya&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi6xMKrgo3mAhUigUsFHZkXAFwQ6AEIOTAC#v=onepage&q=kampatimar%20shankariya&f=false|title=Serial Killers|last=Newton|first=Michael|date=2008|publisher=Infobase Publishing|isbn=978-1-4381-1725-6|language=en}} |- | [[Yang Xinhai]] | {{CHN}} | 2000 to 2003 | 67 | 67 | Known as the "Monster Killer". Would enter victims' homes at night and kill using axes, meat cleavers, hammers, and shovels. Executed by gunshot in 2004.{{cite news|first=Vivian |last=Cui |title=Using hammer, shovel or axe, serial killer of 65 struck victims as they slept. Yang Xinhai's motives were rape and robbery, police say of four-province rampage. |date=2003-11-22 |url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-19450316_ITM |work=South China Morning Post |accessdate=2008-09-13 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090112145516/http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-19450316_ITM |archivedate=2009-01-12 |url-status=live}} |- | [[Andrei Chikatilo]] | {{Flag|USSR}} | 1978 to 1990 | 53 | 56 | Known as "The Butcher of [[Rostov-on-Don|Rostov]]", "The Red Ripper" or "The Rostov Ripper". Convicted of the murder of 53 women and children between 1978 and 1990. One man was previously convicted and executed for his first murder. Executed by gunshot in 1994. {{cite news|title=World's worst killers |date=1999-10-30 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/495477.stm |work=BBC News |accessdate=2019-10-13}} |- | [[Anatoly Onoprienko]] | {{Flag|Soviet Union}}
{{UKR}} | 1989 to 1996 | 52 | 52+ | Known as "The Beast of Ukraine", "[[The Terminator]]" and "Citizen O". Convicted of the murders of nine people in 1989 and 43 people in 1995–1996. Traveled throughout Europe illegally from 1990 to 1995; whether he killed during this time is unknown. Sentenced to death, later commuted to imprisonment for life. Died from heart failure in 2013. |- | [[Samuel Little]] | {{US}} | 1970 to 2005 | 50 | 93 | Was convicted of killing three women, but later investigations linked 31 other murders to him. Little is now thought to be America's most prolific serial killer. He claims he killed as many as 93 victims total, three above his initial confession of 90, the FBI later confirmed a total of 50 murders linked to Little. The investigations into his crimes are ongoing.{{cite news|url=https://www.apnews.com/3bb015f58147476e8e5a50a97ed460b3|title=Prosecutor: More than 60 deaths now linked to serial killer|first=David|last=Warren|agency=Associated Press|publisher=Associated Press, LLC|location=[[New York City]]|date=June 7, 2019|accessdate=June 7, 2019}}{{cite news|url=https://www.fbi.gov/news/stories/samuel-little-most-prolific-serial-killer-in-us-history-100619|title= Confessions of a Killer:FBI Seeking Assistance Connecting Victims to Samuel Little’s Confessions|author=Federal Bureau of Investigation: News and Features|date=October 6, 2019|accessdate=October 9, 2019}} |- | [[Florisvaldo de Oliveira]] | {{BRA}} | 1982 | 50 | 50+ | Known as "Cabo Bruno"; former police officer and vigilante who murdered criminals in the outskirts of [[São Paulo]]; murdered by unknown assailants in 2012.{{cite web|url=http://f5.folha.uol.com.br/saiunonp/2015/03/1607636-cabo-bruno-mata-50-e-morre-com-20-tiros.shtml|title=Cabo Bruno kills 50 and dies with 20 shots|author=Luiz Carlos Ferreira|publisher=F5|date=25 March 2015|accessdate=29 December 2017|language=Portuguese}} |- | [[Robert Pickton|Willy Pickton]] | {{Flag|Canada}} | 1983 to 2002 | 49 | 49 | Nicknamed "The Butcher"; Robert Pickton was a Canadian serial killer who killed 49 women and disposed of their bodies by feeding them to his pigs. He was convicted of only 6 murders but charged for his proven 49 victims. Unfortunately, much to the anger of the victims families, the remaining 43 charges were stayed or dropped. |- | [[Gary Ridgway]] | {{US}} | 1982 to 2000 | 49 | 71–90+ | Truck painter who confessed to killing 71 women. Also known as The Green River Killer. He almost exclusively targeted [[sex workers]] from [[Seattle]]. Suspected of killing over 90 victims, confessed to 71, convicted of 49.{{cite news|url=http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/localnews/2014154781_ridgway08m.html |title=Attorney: Ridgway will likely plead guilty to new murder charge |work=The Seattle Times |accessdate=7 February 2011 |first=Jennifer |last=Sullivan |date=7 February 2011 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110209073021/http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/localnews/2014154781_ridgway08m.html |archivedate=9 February 2011 |df= }} Sentenced to life without parole and currently imprisoned in [[ADX Florence]] in [[Colorado]].{{cite web|url=https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/crime/ridgway-moved-to-colorado-prison-to-end-long-isolation/|title=Green River killer moved to Colorado prison to end isolation|last=Carter|first=Mike|date=2015-09-04|website=The Seattle Times|language=en-US|access-date=2019-05-24}} |- | [[Alexander Pichushkin]] | {{RUS}} | 1992 to 2006 | 48 | 60 | Known as the Chessboard Killer. Convicted of murdering 48 victims and suspected of killing 60. Claimed to have murdered 62 people, because he did not know that two of his victims had survived; stated goal of becoming Russia's most prolific serial killer.{{cite news |title= Russia 'chessboard killer' guilty|url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7059939.stm |work= [[BBC News]] |date= 2007-10-24 |accessdate = 2007-10-29 }} Sentenced to imprisonment for life. |- | [[Wang Qiang (serial killer)|Wang Qiang]] | {{CHN}} | 1995 to 2003 | 45 | 60+ | Killed 45 and raped 10 from 1995 to 2003.{{cite web|url=http://shang.cnfamily.com/200506/ca16435.htm |script-title=zh:残杀45人，嗜血魔头没有父母没有家 |publisher=家庭期刊集团 原载《家庭》2005年6期 文/肖 宁 |year=2005 |accessdate=2010-07-30 |language=Zh |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120306233447/http://shang.cnfamily.com/200506/ca16435.htm |archivedate=2012-03-06 |df= }} Executed in 2005. |- | [[Ahmad Suradji]] | {{IDN}} | 1986 to 1997 | 42 | 70–80+ | Convicted of strangling at least 42 women and girls in a series of ritual slayings he believed would give him magical powers. Executed by firing squad in 2008.{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/indonesia/2286216/Black-Magic-Killer-executed-for-42-murders.html|title=Black Magic Killer executed for 42 murders|date=11 July 2008|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=14 December 2016|last1=Correspondent|first1=Thomas Bell}} |- | [[Raman Raghav]] | {{Flag|India}} | 1965 to 1968 | 41 | 41 | In the late 1960s Raman Raghav went on a violent rampage in Mumbai, India. He bludgeoned 41 people to death inside their huts while they slept. |- | [[Tiago Henrique Gomes da Rocha]] | {{BRA}} | 2011 to 2014 | 39 | data-sort-value="39"|~39 | Brazilian security guard who confessed to the murders of 39 people. Attempted suicide in prison. Sentenced to 25 years.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/brazilian-serial-killer-suspect-thiago-henrique-gomes-da-rocha-26-confesses-to-39-murders-9800574.html|title=Brazilian serial killer suspect Thi ago Henrique Gomes da Rocha, 26, 'confesses to 39 murders'|newspaper=independent.co.uk| date=17 October 2014|accessdate=17 October 2014}} |- | [[Moses Sithole]] | {{ZAF}} | 1994 to 1995 | 38 | 38+ | Known as South Africa's Ted Bundy. Preyed on unemployed women, posing as a businessman and luring his victims with the prospects of a job, before leading them to an isolated place, where he raped, tortured, and murdered them. Sentenced to 2410 years imprisonment with a non-parole period of 930 years.[http://www.maximonline.com/articles/index.aspx?a_id=448 A Time to Kill], Philip von Nekerk, ''[[Maxim (magazine)|Maxim]]'', October 2000 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071217231427/http://www.maximonline.com/articles/index.aspx?a_id=448 |date=17 December 2007 }} |- | [[Serhiy Tkach]] | {{Flag|USSR}}
{{UKR}} | 1984 to 2005 | 36 | 80–100 | A former Ukrainian police criminal investigator, suffocated girls aged between eight and 18 and performed sexual acts on their bodies after they were dead. Claims to have killed 100. Sentenced to imprisonment for life. Died from heart failure in 2018.{{Cite news|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20081224-serhiy-tkach-killer-murder-29-girls-young-women-life-sentence-ukraine|title=Killer who took lives of 29 girls and young women gets life|work=France 24|access-date=2018-03-26}} |- | [[Gennady Mikhasevich]] | {{Flag|USSR}} | 1971 to 1985 | 36 | 43–55+ | Strangled women. Besides killing, he also robbed his victims of money and valuable items (that he would sometimes give to his wife as a gift). Executed by firing squad in 1987.{{cite web|url=http://crynews.ru/persprint/553.html |title=Михасевич Геннадий – полная биография |publisher=Crynews.ru |accessdate=2013-11-23 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110830133946/http://crynews.ru/persprint/553.html |archivedate=2011-08-30 |df= }} |- | [[Hadj Mohammed Mesfewi]] | {{Flag|Morocco}} | 1906 and earlier | 36 | 36+ | Known as "[[Marrakesh]] Arch-Killer"; drugged, mutilated and murdered women; executed 1906. |- | [[Vera Renczi]] | {{Flag|Romania}}
{{Flag|Yugoslavia}}
{{Flag|Hungary}} (alleged) | 1920 to 1930 |35 |~35 | Romanian serial killer nicknamed, "The Black Widow" convicted of killing 35 men through [[arsenic]] poisoning but confessed to only killing 32 victims. Renczi is the world's most prolific female serial killer. However, there is very little information about Renczi and her crimes because personal information (criminal history, academic records, and etc.) were not cataloged as well as they are today, making some criminologists believe she was a figure of Romanian folklore rather than an actual person.Newton, Michael. ''The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers''. p. 198. Checkmark Book. 2000. {{ISBN|978-0-8160-3979-1}} |- | [[Ted Bundy]] | {{US}} | 1974 to 1978 | 35 | 36+ | American serial killer known for his charisma and good looks. Bundy officially confessed to 30 homicides, but had confessed to killing 35–36 women in the past, and some estimates run upwards of 100 or more. Infamous for escaping from prison twice and murdering multiple victims in one day; sometimes abducting women from the same location within hours of one another.[[Polly Nelson]], ''Defending the Devil: My Story as Ted Bundy's Last Lawyer''. William Morrow, 1994, 329 pages. {{ISBN|978-0-688-10823-6}} He was executed by electric chair in 1989.{{cite news| title = Bundy Finally Draws Cheers: Hundreds Celebrate Execution| date = 1989-01-25| newspaper = Orlando Sentinel| url = http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1989-01-25/news/8901250246_1_ted-bundy-electric-chair-death-row| accessdate = 2011-07-19}}{{cite news| title = Death Of An Evil Man Is No Cause For Mirth| date = 1989-01-25| newspaper = Sun-Sentinel| url = http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1989-01-25/features/8901050452_1_execution-ted-bundy-pleasure| accessdate = 2011-07-19}} |- | [[Clementine Barnabet]] | {{US}} | 1911 | 35 | 35 | An axe murdering voodoo priestess who murdered African-American families at nighttime.{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=5M3-CgAAQBAJ&pg=PA187&dq=%22clementine+barnabet%22&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiojYPhnq7aAhUl1oMKHcAdAAoQ6AEIJzAA#v=onepage&q=%22clementine%20barnabet%22&f=false|title=Dark Bayou: Infamous Louisiana Homicides|last=Gauthreaux|first=Alan G.|last2=Hippensteel|first2=D. G.|date=2015-11-16|publisher=McFarland|isbn=9781476662954|language=en}} |- | [[John Wayne Gacy]] | {{US}} | 1972 to 1978 | 33 | 34+ | Known to have murdered a minimum of 33 teenage boys and young men between 1972 and 1978, 26 of whom he buried in the [[Crawl space (basement)|crawl space]] of his [[Chicago, Illinois|Chicago]] home. Gacy was known as the "Killer Clown" due to the fact he often entertained children at social events dressed in a self devised clown costume. Executed by lethal injection in 1994.[http://www.freeinfosociety.com/site.php?postnum=103 John Wayne Gacy Jr.: Biography], Jonathan Dunder, ''The Free Information Society'' |- | [[Asghar the Murderer|Ali Asghar Borujerdi]] | {{Flag|Ottoman Empire}}
[[File:Flag of Iraq (1921–1959).svg|22px]] [[Mandatory Iraq|Iraq]]
[[File:Flag of Iran (1925).svg|22px]] [[Pahlavi dynasty|Persia]] | 1907 to 1934 | 33 | 33 | Known as "Asghar the Murderer". Killed 33 young adults in Iraq and Iran. Executed by hanging in 1934.Schayegh, C. "Serial Murder in Tehran: Crime, Science, and the Formation of Modern State and Society in Interwar Iran". ''History Comparative Studies in Society and History'', 47(4) October 2005, pp. 836–862. Killed 14 women in 1964–1970 in Poland's region of Dąbrowa Basin. Zdzisław Marchwicki was most likely the man responsible for the killings; however, his guilt remains in dispute. Executed in 1977.{{cite web | url=http://killer.radom.net/~sermord/New/zbrodnia.php-dzial=mordercy&dane=MarchwickiZdzislaw.htm | title=Www.zbrodnia.of.pl / mordercy / Marchwicki Zdzislaw}} |- | [[Monster of Florence]] | {{ITA}} | 1968 to 1985 | 14 | 16 | Unidentified killer who shot couples in lovers lanes and mutilated the women, taking their sexual organs and in the last two cases, also their left breast. 69-year-old farmer Pietro Pacciani was controversially convicted of 14 crimes in 1994 and sentenced to life in prison, but he was released following allegations that the scant evidence had been planted in an attempt to close the case, which was by then the largest and [[Media circus|most mediatic]] in Italy's criminal history. Pacciani was scheduled for retrial in 1998 when he died after taking medication contraindicated to his heart problems. Pacciani's two alleged accomplices, Mario Vanni and Giancarlo Lotti, were sentenced to life and 30 years in prison, respectively. Notes |- | [[Ivomoku Bakusuba]] || {{flag|Burundi}} || 1940s || 67 || || Confessed to killing 67 children by strangling them with a bedsheet. {{flag|Nazi Germany}} || 1928 to 1943 || 51 || 86 || Mentally disabled, Lüdke was arrested after being discovered with a corpse. Police declared him insane and imprisoned him in a psychiatric hospital, where he died when he was experimented on. The only evidence tying him to the crimes was a confession that may have been physically coerced. He was never given a trial and he is generally{{By whom|date=September 2018}} considered innocent.Florian Stark: ''[https://www.welt.de/geschichte/article180948928/Hinrichtung-So-starb-der-groesste-Serienmoerder-der-Kriminalgeschichte.html So starb der größte Serienmörder der Kriminalgeschichte]'', [[Die Welt]], 13 August 2018. |- | [[Highway of Tears murders|"Highway of Tears" Killer]] || {{CAN}} || 1969 to 2018 ?|| 18 || 83 || All the victims were young women and were last seen on [[British Columbia Highway 16|Highway 16]] in [[British Columbia]] between [[Prince George, BC|Prince George]] and [[Prince Rupert, BC|Prince Rupert]]. If they were all victims of the same person, it would be one of the most proficient serial killers in Canada and one with the longest career in the world. Some of the murders have been linked to American criminal [[Bobby Jack Fowler]], although he was in prison at the time others were committed.{{cite web|title=Canada's Missing & Murdered Aboriginal Women|url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvntPLkd9IMfv0MM4066Rhir2ImBYFAgl|website=YouTube|accessdate=8 December 2015}} {{cite web|title=worst love story ever |url=https://bc.ctvnews.ca/mobile/worst-ever-love-story-father-of-slain-australian-man-pleads-for-information-1.4518845 |accessdate=22 July 2019}} |- | [[Gerald Stano]] || {{US}} || 1969 to 1980 || 22+ || 41 || Confessed to killing 41 women in mostly Florida and New Jersey areas. Some controversy surrounds the case as he is believed by some to have been a [[serial confessor]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/crime/gerard-schaefer-jr-s-stories-filed-memoir-article-1.3002274|title=Gerard Schaefer Jr.'s stories could have been filed as memoir|work=NY Daily News|access-date=2018-03-08}} |- | [[Orlando Sabino]] || {{BRA}} || 1966 ? - 1971 ? || 12 || || Suspected of murdering 12 people in [[Minas Gerais]] and [[Goiás]], as well as mutilating several animals; sentenced to 38 years imprisonment and died from a heart attack in 2013. There are many theories that he was actually framed by the [[Military Dictatorship in Brazil]], who did the murders for political reasons.[http://www.portaldearaguari.com.br/2011/05/historia-do-monstro-de-capinopolis.html The story of the "Monster of Capinópolis" wins book] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170414082946/http://www.portaldearaguari.com.br/2011/05/historia-do-monstro-de-capinopolis.html |date=2017-04-14 }} Accessed on 24 July 2016 |- | [[Pedro Rosa da Conceição]] || {{BRA}} || 1904 to 1911, ??? || 3 || 17 || Brazilian mass murderer who killed three people and wounded thirteen others on April 22, 1904. Killed his cellmate and a guard in 1911, and is said to have murdered a family of twelve people in an unspecified date and year. Died in 1919. The family murders are not verified. |- | [[Henry Lee Lucas]] || {{US}} || 1960 to 1983 || 3 || 3000+ || Confessed to killing at least 600 people but later recanted and is suspected of lying about a majority of the murders. He originally offered a list of 77 women from 19 different states, but as he confessed to more and more murders, the details became increasingly more bizarre. Some included dismemberment, necrophilia, even cannibalism. Lawmen linked Lucas and [[Ottis Toole]] to 81 murders only. Convicted of 11 [[murder]]s.{{cite web|url=https://hellhorror.com/killers/serial_killer/51/Henry-Lee-Lucas.html |title=Henry Lee Lucas|publisher=Hellhorror.com |accessdate=2013-11-23}} The true number of murders committed by Lucas is unknown, but it is likely Lucas was not nearly as prolific a serial killer as he initially claimed to be, as most of his murder confessions were thoroughly discredited, and he himself claimed only one murder—that of his mother.{{cite web|url=http://www.mayhem.net/Crime/lucas.html |title=Mayhem.net |publisher=Mayhem.net |accessdate=2013-11-23}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nndb.com/people/426/000027345/ |title=Henry Lee Lucas |publisher=NNDB.com |accessdate=2013-11-23}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.crimemagazine.com/henry-lee-lucas|title=Henry Lee Lucas Crime Magazine|website=www.crimemagazine.com|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100704155447/http://www.crimemagazine.com/lucas.htm|archivedate=4 July 2010}} |- | [[Charles Quansah]] || {{GHA}} || 1993 to 2001 || 8 || 34 || Quansah, who had been in prison for rape twice, was held as a suspect in the deaths of 34 women across the country, including his girlfriend who was strangled in 2000, and eventually confessed to eight murders. He later denied the killings, claiming that the confessions had been extracted under torture, and that the police had also tried unsuccessfully to force him to implicate a number of politicians including former president [[Jerry Rawlings]], his wife [[Nana Konadu Agyeman]] and an unidentified member of president [[John Kufuor]]'s administration.{{cite web|url=http://www.modernghana.com/GhanaHome/NewsArchive/news_details.asp?id=VFZSUmVFMXFZejA9&type=§ion=&gender=General_News&menu_id=1&menu_id2=0&sub_menu_id=0|title=Serial Killer Arrested|work=Modern Ghana}}{{cite web|url=http://www.modernghana.com/GhanaHome/NewsArchive/news_details.asp?id=VFhwck1VNUVZejA9&type=§ion=&gender=General_News&menu_id=1&menu_id2=0&sub_menu_id=0|title=Serial Killer Speaks Out|work=Modern Ghana}} |- | [[Ottis Toole]] || {{US}} || 1980 to 1983 || 7 || 100–125 || Initially convicted of three counts of murder, later pleading guilty to four more murders before dying in prison. A sometime accomplice of convicted serial killer [[Henry Lee Lucas]], Toole admitted to—and retracted multiple times—over 100 counts of murder, rape, arson and cannibalism, and was the suspect in several other unsolved murders. In 2008, police announced that they had identified Toole as the likely murderer of [[Murder of Adam Walsh|Adam Walsh]], and would be closing the case as a result.{{cite news|title=The Twisted Life of Serial Killer Ottis Elwood Toole|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/2008/12/16/twisted-life-serial-killer-ottis-elwood-toole.html|accessdate=21 December 2017|work=Fox News|agency=UPI|date=16 December 2008}} |- | [[Wayne Williams]] || {{US}} || 1979 to 1981 || 2 || 24–31 || Believed to have perpetrated the [[Atlanta murders of 1979–1981]]. After being convicted of two murders and sentenced to life imprisonment, authorities closed 22 other unsolved murders, declaring Williams to have been the perpetrator. Williams has maintained his innocence and the case was reopened in 2005.{{cite news|title=Cold-case squad to probe decades-old Atlanta murders |publisher=CNN |date=7 May 2005 |url=http://articles.cnn.com/2005-05-07/justice/wayne.williams_1_unsolved-murder-cold-case-squad-murder-cases?_s=PM:LAW |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120708220719/http://articles.cnn.com/2005-05-07/justice/wayne.williams_1_unsolved-murder-cold-case-squad-murder-cases?_s=PM:LAW |url-status=dead |archive-date=8 July 2012 }} |- | [[Joe Ball]] || {{US}} || 1937 to 1938 || 2 || 20 || Bootlegger and barman known as the "Butcher of [[Elmendorf, Texas|Elmendorf]]", the "Bluebeard of South Texas", and "the Alligator Man" because of the [[alligator]] pit he had in the back of his bar and where he entertained clients by throwing live animals to the reptiles. Ball killed two barmaids but he shot himself fatally in the chest when police came to question him and was never arrested or interrogated. [[Yellow press]] and pulp magazines later exaggerated his exploits, claiming that he had killed up to 20 women and fed them to the alligators, but this was never proven and caused some of Ball's relatives to sue such publications. Police investigated about a dozen women that had worked at Ball's place and were missing at the time of his suicide; some were found alive in [[San Antonio, Texas|San Antonio]], but others could not be accounted for.{{cite web|last=Hall |first=Michael |url=http://www.texasmonthly.com/content/two-barmaids-five-alligators-and-butcher-elmendorf/page/0/2 |title=Two Barmaids, Five Alligators and the Butcher of Elmendorf |work=Texas Monthly |date=1938-09-23 |accessdate=2013-11-23}} |- | [[Abdul Latif Sharif]] || {{MEX}} || 1995 || 1 || 18–20 || [[Egypt]]ian chemist known as "The [[Jackal]] of [[Ciudad Juárez]]". After migrating to the [[United States]] in the 1970s, Sharif served 14 years in prison for several rapes but fled to Mexico when he was about to be deported to his home country. There, he was accused of up to 20 of the [[female homicides in Ciudad Juárez]] but was convicted of only one, to 30 years in prison, where he died of natural causes in 2006. As the high rate of female murders has continued to this day in Ciudad Juárez, it has been claimed that Sharif was used as a scapegoat by the Mexican police.{{cite web|url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/notas/353176.html|title=They buried the feminicides in Ciudad Juárez|author=Carlos Coria Rivas|publisher=The Universal Chihuahua|date=3 July 2006|accessdate=12 May 2012|language=Spanish}} |- | [[Daisuke Mori]] || {{JPN}} || 2000 and earlier || 1 || 11+ || Nurse that was sentenced to life imprisonment for one murder but suspected of killing at least 10 others. He might have confessed to some of the murders in order to protect others.{{Cite news|url=https://mainichi.jp/english/articles/20180228/p2g/00m/0dm/069000c|title=High court rejects retrial appeal over 2000 murder by ex-nurse|date=2018-02-28|work=Mainichi Daily News|access-date=2018-03-08|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180309182757/https://mainichi.jp/english/articles/20180228/p2g/00m/0dm/069000c|archive-date=2018-03-09|url-status=dead|df=}} |- | [[Bevan Spencer von Einem]] || {{AUS}} || 1979? to 1983 || 1 || 10 || Arrested for three and convicted of one of "[[The Family Murders]]", where four teenagers and one young adult, all male, were drugged, kidnapped, raped and mutilated for several weeks before their bodies were abandoned in the countryside near [[Adelaide, Australia|Adelaide]]. Police believed that von Einem had several accomplices, none of whom was publicly identified or detained, and at the time of his trial it was widely reported that the murders had been committed by a group of four to 12 high-profile Australian men; von Einem himself claimed to be the victim of a conspiracy. He has also been considered a suspect in the disappearance of two girls near the [[Adelaide Oval]] in 1973 and the high-profile [[Beaumont children disappearance]] in 1966.{{cite news |url=http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,25197,20664321-5006787,00.html |title=Sex killer cashes in | The Australian |publisher=Theaustralian.news.com.au |date=29 October 2006 |accessdate=2008-10-15 |first=Nigel |last=Hunt |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090328195531/http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,25197,20664321-5006787,00.html |archive-date=28 March 2009 |url-status=dead |df=dmy-all }} |- | [[Edgar Matobato]] || {{Flag|Philippines}} || 1988 to 2013 || 0 || Hundreds || Self-confessed hitman and serial killer claiming to have killed people as part of the [[Davao Death Squad]]; his claims' authenticity has been challenged.{{cite web|url=http://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/in-depth/147414-edgar-matobato-liar-truth-teller|title=Edgar Matobato: Liar or truth-teller?|publisher=}} |- | [[John Bodkin Adams]] || {{nowrap|{{GBR}}}} || 1946 to 1956 || 0 || 163 || Acquitted in a highly unusual trial in 1957 of murder but later found guilty of fraud. Existence (and probable but not proven identity) discovered more than 100 years after the murders, by analysis of contemporary records, showing a markedly common modus operandi for many previously unconnected murders.{{Cite book|title=The man from the train: The Solving of a Century-Old Serial Killer Mystery|last=James|first=Bill and Rachel|publisher=Simon and Schuster|year=2017|isbn=|location=|pages=}} |- | [[David Parker Ray]] || {{US}} || 1950 to 1999 || 0 || 60 || Torture-murderer possibly aided by numerous accomplices, including his girlfriend. Convicted of attempted killing of three victims and is suspected of 60 murders, even though no bodies were ever found. Known as the "Toybox Killer" for the self-built mobile home he used in the rape, torture, and killing of women.{{cite news|last1=Proctor|first1=Jeff|title=Updated: Victim Tells of Captivity|url=https://www.abqjournal.com/70489/victim-tells-of-captivity.html|accessdate=9 January 2017|work=www.abqjournal.com|agency=Journal Staff|publisher=Albuquerque Journal|date=19 November 2011|ref=abqJournal|location=Albuquerque, N.M.}} |- | [[Smiley face murder theory|Smiley Face Killer]] || {{US}} || 1990s to 2000s || 0 || 40+ || Theoretical serial killer(s) thought by some sources to have drowned college-aged young men across the northern part of the country since 1997; most experts suggest that the deaths were accidental.{{cite press release |title=FBI Statement Regarding Midwest River Deaths |publisher= fbi.gov |url=https://www.fbi.gov/news/pressrel/press-releases/fbi-statement-regarding-midwest-river-deaths }} |- | [[Marie Besnard]] || {{FRA}} || 1927 to 1949 || 0 || 13 || Charged with the murders of 13 relatives with arsenic, all of whom had Besnard as their sole designated heir, but acquitted of all charges after three high-profile trials that lasted a decade.{{Cite journal |last1=Darnton |first1=Robert |authorlink=Robert Darnton |date=5 April 1973 |title=French History: The Case of the Wandering Eye |journal=The New York Review of Books |url=http://www.nybooks.com/articles/archives/1973/apr/05/french-history-the-case-of-the-wandering-eye/ |accessdate=12 October 2014 }} |} * ''Proven victims'' being victims the serial killer was tried for, explained by the killer in a detailed confession, or victims most scholars of the subject agree upon. == See also == * [[Axe murder]]s * [[List of serial rapists by number of victims]] * [[List of rampage killers]] * [[List of serial killers by country]] * [[Spree killer]] == References == {{reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{commons category-inline|Serial killers}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2019}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Serial killers}} [[Category:Serial killers|*]] [[Category:Lists by death toll]] [[Category:Lists of murderers|serial victims]]
